body:
out of interest are you working with @jfsiii or are you both creating the same thing?

I think the file manager should have a call to add on .less which can be implemented in the abstract file manager - then you can override it to not add on any extension.

Here is what calls the file manager
https://github.com/less/less.js/blob/master/lib/less/import-manager.js
but here is what adds on .less at the moment
https://github.com/less/less.js/blob/master/lib/less/tree/import.js#L71
Hrmm - it also looks at the import options - so a css file will not get .less added on to it..

Thanks for the references.

I couldn't found an existing project (I search for one ~8 hours ago), so this is my own - but I couldn't upload it yet. I could do that tomorrow, if its not the same as @jfsiii's. Is your project already on GitHub?
I should have time tonight to make a fix for you.
Will be tomorrow, sorry but it's the next thing on my list.

issue.title: FileManager API: How to handle loading of multiple files at once?

body:
Okay, this is fixed, override tryAppendLessExtension and return the first parameter unchanged and .less will never get appended.
Can you test against HEAD or would you like a beta 2 release? I'd rather do a beta 2 when you confirm there aren't any issues with this.
I can try against HEAD. (I'm currently writing unit tests. My plugin should be live in the next three hours.)

Sorry, triple post. (Does GitHub notify someone if a comment is updated?)

Plugin is live and published to npm now: https://github.com/Mercateo/less-plugin-bower-resolve. I already use `"^2.0.0-b2"` as a `devDependency` so `$ npm install` will throw an error until b2 is published. But it mainly works as I hoped. Looking forward to 2.0.0! Thank you.

> Does GitHub notify someone if a comment is updated?

Nope.

Do you want to create a pull request against less-docs to publicize?
Thanks for the plugin.
